Name: Puppy Play!
Description:
This is a card game using different breeds of puppies as suits and cats as wild cards. It also includes a spinner with numbers from 1 to 10. The instructions contain rules for 5 different games: 
No More Puppies
Pile of Puppies
Puppy Rummy
Puppy Memory (with a twist)
Plenty of Puppies!

Name: Stalingrad:  The Leather Factory
Description:
Stalingrad: The Leather Factory, 2nd ed. is a solitaire strategy game depicting the battle of Kuporosnoye, September 13-15, 1942 between the German 29th Division and the Russian 35th Guards Division at the beginning of the epic battle for the city. This area was at the southern edge of greater Stalingrad, with a large leather factory along its north side. In the game, the player (Germans) tries to capture objective hexes and headquarter locations from the Russians (played by the game system).

The game uses a solitaire system that reflects the historical situation but includes enough variability and uncertainty to enhance the fog of war feeling to foster replayability. The standard game is suitable for novice wargamers. There are advanced optional rules presented that contain rules that may be “plugged in” as desired to the standard game, to provide a more detailed and challenging game for veteran players. Designed by Gary Graber.

Tactical, company-level, 300 yard hexes, 100 counters, 8.5"x11" color map, 16-page instructions, designed specifically for solitaire play, stresses high playability and historicity.  The game puts you in command of elements of the German 29th Division, pushing towards the Volga.

This second edition offers newly revised rules, optional rules, and components.


1st edition description

This is a solitaire design based on the early September, 1942 German assault on Kuporosnoye at the far south of Stalingrad.  The player controls the German 29th Division, and the game system handles the Russian 35th Guards Division defenders.  The game includes 8.5" x 11" cardstock map, set of uncut, color unit counters, and full rules.  This game is presented as a simple "standard game" suitable for novices, to which several advanced options can be added.  The game stresses "uncertainty" for the solitaire wargamer, which is provided by hidden Russian units, random reinforcements, variable "daily orders" from HQ, and imprecise victory conditions. Published in Panzer Digest #3.

Name: Panzer Korps: Campaigns – Rules & Scenarios
Description:
This supplement adds a variety of campaigns for the Panzer Korps operation scale WW II rules, though the order of battle and maps are sufficiently detailed that they could be used for other games if desired.  Twenty scenarios spanning the West Front, East Front, North Africa, and Pacific theaters from 1935 through 1944.  Each scenario includes forces and maps for the first battle of the campaign.  Additional battles in the campaign are based on the results of the previous battle(s).  For example, if the offense breaks through the defense in one battle, the next battle may be fought with the defender employing a delaying action with hasty defenses.

Typical table sizes are 6'x4', although table sizes up to 12' are used for larger campaigns.

Expands:

    Panzer Korps:  Divisional Level Warfare 1936-1945
Families: Series: Panzer Korps Miniature Wargame (Hoplite Research Games)

Name: Worms
Description:
Worms is a Board Game inspired by the Team17 game of the same name. It brings the strange combination of utter
silliness and tactics from the computer game to the table top.
Worms is game for two to four players and usually on takes about 10 minutes to play. Each player controls one team
of four combat ready Worms. Each worm comes equipped with a variety of weapons from the lowly Pistol to the
awesome and lethal Sheep. (copied from the rulebook)

(Not available online at this time)

Name: Killer Nobles
Description:
This card game can be player with a standard deck of cards and was inspired by the hilarious game "Killer Bunnies". If your a fan of the Killer Bunnies game then you will recognize some of the game play mechanics given here. However you will also not fail to notice that it plays significantly differently.

Background Story
In ancient times Noble families fought each other over the diamond mines. They collected diamonds and tried constantly to kill the Nobles of other families. With their competition removed the name and reputation of their own family would rise.

(copied from website)

Game Link: http://www.bookranger.co.uk/CardGames/KillerNobles.htm

Name: Kartazma RGK
Description:
Kartazma is a Polish CCG whose topic is the  CCG players life. You are controlling a group of characters that are CCG fans. During deck construction you may choose from 3 general types of "heros": Collector ("Kolekcjoner"), Tournament player ("Turniejowiec") and Social guy ("SpoÅ‚ecznik"). There are also cards that represent locations like shops or clubs where you can play, some stuff cards: cell phones, bags, card protectors and finally some quests that you have to accomplish before your opponent does to win the game (like a good trade or wining 3 tournaments).

You will have to construct 3 decks: a main deck ("Talia gÅ‚ówna") with exactly 40 cards, character deck ("Talia Karciarzy") with 10 cards + one main character and quest deck ("Talia wyzwaÅ„") with 5-7 cards. Each of players must also have 3 locations which he will use during that game.

Name: Ta-Se
Description:
This is light game where each player has 8 chips ranging from 1 to 8. There are 3 cups. Each player takes a turn placing this chips in the cups. Whoever wins the most cups wins the round. There a few scoring twists involved.

Get the full game rules from: http://www.gamecabinet.com/rules/TaSe.html

Name: ESCAPE!
Description:
This game is played on chess sized board. Up to 4 players will maneuver around, trying to collect 6 keys E , S , C , A , P , E! to Escape! They will have to dodge the guards or else will get sent back to their cell. On your turn you have 4 moves, in which you can move the guards, the keys and yourself.

Get this game here: http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/escape.htm

Name: TALK.BIZARRE, The Board Game
Description:
The "T.B, the Board Game" duplicates all the action of a typical month of talk.bizarre! From the creative postings of most respected oldbie, to the hapless struggling of the most mediocre cavenewt, and yes, even down to the pathetic mewlings of the rankest newbie--you will be there! You will cringe from the heat of the flamewars and the razor sharp wit of the repartee! You will experience the thrill of posting great articles, the shame of posting pathetic articles, and the surge of triumph as you show no mercy, pushing your fellow players over the brink of the volcano... (from the website)

Full Rules from: http://www.gamecabinet.com/rules/TalkBizarre.html

Name: Domination
Description: Domination is an abstract strategy game for 2. You will need a chessboard, some checkers and dominoes to play. You pick up the dominoes, place them on the board to restrict movement and then move your piece. If a player is unable to move, that player loses.

Name: The Waterloo Campaign
Description:
Napoleon returned to power from Elba to find the Great Powers of Europe united against him. Realizing that he was massively outnumbered, he decided his best chance was to attack first and try to take out some of his adversaries before they could combine and descend on France. He chose to move against the English and the Prussians in Belgium. Furthermore, he thought that he could achieve a political victory if he could capture Brussels. The Waterloo Campaign is a small-scale, fast-play game that simulates the historical events of June, 1815 which ended the career of Napoleon Bonaparte. The goal of the game is to recreate the problems faced by Napoleon at the operational level and perhaps achieve a better result than arguably the greatest general in history.

Game Features

* Small Scale, Quick Play Microgame
    * Only 28 Unit Counters
    * Colorful Game Map 8 1/2 x 11
    * Operational Level Play
    * Four-Page Rules Booklet
    * Game Play Sheet
    * Counter Sheet To Cut Out
    * Solitaire Play Level: HIGH

(from site)
Full Game: http://www.whitedoggames.com/pnpgames.html

Name: Kasvoton vihollinen
Description:
Kasvoton vihollinen (Faceless enemy in English) is a game for 2 players. Kasvoton vihollinen is a combat game where two armies fight using cards that were drafted partly at random in the beginning of the game. Cards are placed on the board as initial setup and they can move on the board in a somewhat chess like manner.

Rules contain variants to play the game with 4 players as teams and tournament rules.

Name: Pickett's Charge: Day Three of Gettysburg
Description:
Easily the most famous engagement of the Civil War, Pickett's Charge was the high-water mark of the Confederacy. A frontal attack across open ground by 12,000 - 15,000 men against the center of the Union line in the teeth of withering artillery and small arms fire, Pickett's Charge was the defining moment of the battle of Gettysburg and, although militarily futile, represents to many the courage and glory of the Confederate soldier. Pickets Charge: Day Three of Gettysburg is a small-scale, fast-play simulation of historical events of July 3, 1863.

Game Features

* Small Scale Microgame
    * Only 26 Unit Counters
    * Colorful Game Map 8 1/2 x 11
    * Brigade-Level Tactical Play
    * Five-Page Rules Booklet
    * Game Play Sheet
    * Counter Sheets
    * Quick Play Rules
    * Solitaire Play Level: HIGH

(from site)

Full Game: http://www.whitedoggames.com/pnpgames.html

Name: Anzio: The Fight For The Beachhead
Description:
from site

Anzio: The Fight For The Beachhead is a solitaire or two-player mini-game that simulates at the division level the battle of Anzio. The goal of the Anzio-Nettuno amphibious landings and the resulting so-called battle of Anzio, January - May, 1944, was to outflank the German Winter Line and open the way to Rome. A major battle of World War Two, the initial landings were unopposed. Instead, the resulting fight developed to keep the beachhead.

Third Edition:

Game Features
Solitaire Rules
Off-Map Bombardment
Weather
German Air Attacks
12 Turns
Initiative Checks
ï»¿
Game Components
â€‹17" x 11" Game Board
41 5-8" Mounted, Die-Cut Counters and Markers
8-Page Color Rulebook

Name: Greedy Billionaires
Description:
Players attempt to accumulate interlocking groups of corporations that feed off one another so as to avoid paying money to anyone else.

It is a roll and move with a twist.  When a player lands on his own property, income is collected.  When a player lands on another's property that property pays expenses to other industries.  Properties can be developed to increase their income and traded among players.

At the end some of the properties are nationalized and players add up their property and cash value.  The richest billionaire wins!

Name: Galactic Expansion
Description: A light counter-based conquer game, Galactic Expansion is a game where each player has a sector map (the basic set comes with 3).  Each player's turn is split into 5 phases: Economy (Receive resource for colony), Intel (Espionage, Incite Rebellion, Recon, or Sabotage), Combat (dice-based with modifiers), Deployment, End (Expand or Fortify).  The winner is the last person standing.

Name: A Tank Battle Game
Description:
During his work at the Operations Research Office, the physicist George Gamow invented a simple war game to be played by analysts. The game is played with three identical boards, one for each of the players and one for a referee.
The board … represents a tank battlefield by a lattice of hexagons, … some of which are hatched to represent wooded areas of low visibility. The white hexagons represent open fields, and the size of a hexagon represents the “radius of action” of a tank in battle.
Each player starts with ten markers representing tanks at his back line, and “a move” consists in displacing any number of tanks into any of the adjacent hexagons. Each player sees his board only and must infer from the play where his opponent’s tanks are located.
(from the rules)

Get the full game: https://grognard.com/download/games/board/tankgame.pdf

Name: Kenefick
Description:
Kenefick is a non-partnership climbing card game combining various elements from Zheng Fen, Big Two, Poker, and Hearts.

Distinctive features: Deck includes two jokers, which function as wild cards if used in card combinations and the highest card combination if used together. Players score points for going out, and for collecting 10s, Js, Qs, and Ks.  Combinations include singles, pairs, two pairs, three of a kinds, straights, flushes, full houses, four of a kinds, straight flushes, and bombs. Play of a trick always starts as a single card, but can always be trumped up to a higher ranked card combination.

Name: American Eagle
Description: This game consists of 48 cards with questions and answers on them. Start by dealing the cards in equal amounts to all players. The first player starts by asking a question from one of his cards of the player on his left. If that player answers correctly, he gets to take the card and set it aside. If he answers incorrectly, the questioner gets to take a card from that player's hand and set it to his side. If the question is answered incorrectly, the questioner gets to continue to ask other players, until all players have been asked, or the question is answered correctly. If no player gets it, the questioner gets to set that card aside. After all cards are exhausted, the player with the most cards laid aside wins.

Name: Digi-Quate
Description: Digi-Quate is a game invented by a lecturer from the National University of Singapore. Players draw 10 tokens or tiles with numbers or mathematical operators on them and try to form equations on a square grid playing board. Subsequent play intersects with already played tiles, crossword-style. Covering special squares on the board gives bonus points.

Name: Higher Digi-Quate
Description:
Higher Digi-Quate is an advanced version of Digi-Quate. Like Digi-Quate, it was invented by a National University of Singapore lecturer and it is game of forming mathematical equations on a square grid board. Players have hands of 10 tokens showing numbers and mathematical operators. Each turn they try to form an equation, intersecting crossword-style with equations already on the board. Covering special squares on the board gives bonus points.
The feature that distinguishes Higher Digi-Quate from Digi-Quate is that it adds three dice to the game, a green D10 (numbered 0 to 9) and two red D6s (numbered 0 to 4). The board is larger and there are now bonus squares with pictures of a green D10, a red D6 and two red D6s. Placing an equation that covers these dice bonus squares allows the player to roll the dice and their score may be multiplied; there's also a small risk that the score may be multiplied by zero.

Digi-Quate is a game invented by a lecturer from the National University of Singapore. Players draw 10 tokens or tiles with numbers or mathematical operators on them and try to form equations on a square grid playing board. Subsequent play intersects with already played tiles, crossword-style. Covering special squares on the board gives bonus points.

Name: DotCard
Description:
DotCard is a cardgame played over ten or twenty rounds. Each round is finished when any player is out of cards. The remaining players add the points they have left on the cards left in their hand. The winner is the one who completes all rounds with the lowest score.

The cards in DotCard looks like dominoes and each round starts with different card value, e.g. in round one every player has to start with a card that has nine dots, in round two cards with eight dots and so on.

Name: D'Jay
Description: Swedish music trivia game. A DVD is included in the game.

Name: Alice
Description: This game consists of 44 cards. There are 8 sets of 5 cards each, 2 white rabbit cards, and 2 Cheshire Cat cards. The artwork on these cards is based on the Disney movie. This game has a very "Go Fish" feel to it where players are trying to assemble sets by asking each other for cards. However, players can refuse to give up cards by playing white rabbit cards. Additionally, if a player has asked for a card from a player who does not have it, he can play a Cheshire Cat card for a second chance. The game is played in several rounds until one player reaches 50 points.

Name: Alice in Wonderland
Description:
An Alice in Wonderland card game with artwork based on Sir John Tenniel's original illustrations for the books.

This game can be played by several people. The 48 cards make up 16 sets of 3 cards each. The cards in each set have different pictures on them, but the same numbers so you know they belong together. The player who assembles the most sets wins.

Name: Aviation
Description: This is one of the first card games featuring aviation modes of transport. The deck consists of 67 cards. 46 of them represent types of air transportation (balloon, biplane, etc). the other 21 are "consequence" cards.

Name: Baccardo
Description:
Baccardo is an old horse racing card game. It consists of 50 cards and is playable by exactly 4 players. During a game, 1 player is the "bookie" and the others are all "punters."

46 of the cards are horse cards, and the other 4 are one each of "policeman", "welsher", "tipster" and "the odds."

Name: Beat Your Neighbours
Description: This is a "war" type card game published during the 1950s and 1960s by various publishers. The deck consists of 36 cards with colorful pictures on them. The cards are dealt around evenly to all players. Players do not look at their cards. Play starts with one player turning over his top card, then the next player turns over a card. If a "put" card is turned over, the next player has to turn over a specified number of cards. If no additional "put" card is turned over then the player with the first "put" card wins all face up cards. Eventually, one player will possess all cards and be the winner.

Name: Beatrix Potter's Rummy
Description:
This is a very simple rummy type game for young children.

The deck consists of 44 cards. 14 sets of 3 identical cards each, plus 2 signpost cards to be used as wilds. Deal 6 cards to each player with a draw deck in the middle. Turn over the top card to form the discard pile. Each player's turn consists of drawing 1 card and discarding a card. A player will always have only 6 cards either in hand or in matching sets laid down in front of him. When players have formed sets in their hands by drawing and discarding, they may lay them down face up. The first player to have 2 full sets in front of him is the winner of the hand.

Name: Roma Invicta?
Description:
Roma Invicta? is a simulation game about the first two years of Hannibal's campaign in Italy (218-216 BC). The Carthaginians have three armies and the Romans four, the strengths of which are tallied in a chart off the map to save having a lot of counters. These armies are manouvered around the 17 regions of the map of Italy in a simple I go - You go framework, undertaking different actions including ravaging (for the Carthaginians) and combat.

The combat rules are straightforward and simple with a few interesting tweaks such as ambushes. In many cases conflict is restricted to skirmishing between the forces but  chance may cause a larger battle to occur. The Romans have to strike a balance between not risking having their armies utterly destroyed in battle by the wily Hannibal whilst not allowing the empire to become demoralised if the Carthaginians are allowed to ravage the land unimpeded.

The game, given to Society of Ancients members as part of their subscription in 2008, consists of a 20 page A4 rule-book with colour covers, a simple but adequate map and 36 counters which you need to cut out yourself.

Name: Bourse
Description:
There are 56 cards in the deck, and the theme is that of trading world currency. The number of cards used to play varies with the number of players. Game requires at least 3 but may be played with up to 7. The cards include 48 "Capital" cards. 8 each from London, New York, Montreal, Paris, Brussels and Berlin. There are also 7 "rise and fall" cards and 1 "sell" card.

The goal of the game is to make a profit at the "Close of the Market" on whatever currency they hold, which is represented by the "Capital" cards in their hand.

Name: Bread & Honey
Description: This game is played with a pack of 53 cards and is based on the nursery rhyme "Sing a Song of Sixpence." The colorful cards feature the different characters from the rhyme. This is a war-like game where cards are dealt face down to players and they turn cards up one at a time, battling to steal each others cards until finally one player holds all. Special cards like clowns, queens, kings, and maids dictate how many cards must be turned up.

Name: The Bride
Description: A card game dedicated to Princess Alexandria of Denmark, who married Edward VII of Wales in 1863 at Windsor. The game consists of 48 cards with color pictures of wildflowers. It looks like a set collecting card game.

Name: British Birds
Description: The deck consists of 44 cards. There are 8 sets of 5 bird cards, and 4 owl cards. Each of the 8 sets have a letter on them, then each of the birds within the set are numbered 1 through 5. The object of the game is to collect as many sets of 5 with the same letter on them as you can. The game proceeds with players asking for cards from each other and assembling sets. If you have a card but don't want to give it up, you may play an owl card. As soon as you have a set of 5, lay it down in front of you. When all sets have been assembled the game is over.

Name: British Towns
Description:
The deck consists of 44 cards depicting full color artwork of attractions and towns in mainland Britain. The game was published around 1960.

This is a set collecting game that has two different variations of play depending on how many players there are. There is one variation for 2 players, and another for 3 to 6 players.

Name: Cinderella Card Game
Description:
The object of this game is to dispose of all of your cards in sets and score the highest number of points while doing so. This game was published in 1954 and was based on the Disney movie. The deck consists of 12 sets of 3 identical cards each,  6 "Final Cards", and 2 "Prize Cards".

The game rules vary slightly depending on how many are playing.

Name: Wildfire
Description:
Author's Description:

Version 1.1 of the Wildfire rules system, a generic rule set for 15mm science fiction skirmishes (the rules are easily adapted for other scales). Employing a simple and intuitive yet tactical counters-based system with full rules for infantry and vehicles, Wildfire includes a complete design system to let you create forces from your imagination or based on a film or book. An optional background, the Second Sphere, is also included. One hundred and five pages of science fiction action!

Expanded by:

    Wildfire Overkill

Name: Tee Party
Description:
From the box:

A golf game on the 19th hole for golf widows, hackers, and experts.

The game comes with 4 pawns, 8 stroke counters, 64 cards, and 5 different hole layouts.

Name: Jenga: New York Yankees Collector's Edition
Description:
Take the Yankees to the top!

Play Jenga a fun new way – with New York Yankees blocks and die! It’s the same great Jenga with a baseball twist. Build your tower with Yankees blue and gray blocks. As the tower builds so does the difficulty. Custom Yankees Jenga rules throw each player a curve ball making the game even more fun – and more challenging! Game comes complete with 54 Yankees hard wood Jenga blocks, 1 custom die, custom Yankees Jenga baseball rules and a loading tray for assembly.

Name: K'uhul
Description:
A quick playing game of wits for 2 players.

The K'uhul is a sacred ring of standing stone statues, once erected to appease the bloodthirsty god, Coatlicue. Although many mysteries surround K'uhul, it has remained fairly harmless over the past 1000 years.

Now two rival shamans have arrived to worship at the sacred site and discover that they are in violent disagreement over the origins and purpose of K'uhul. The only thing they agree on is that K'uhul is a gate to untold power.

As their increasingly heated arguments begin to disrupt the local village--the village Head Man decides to end the bickering by holding a contest: the first shaman to be able to successfully activate the power of K'uhul will win the respect and riches of the village, while the loser will be sacrificed to appease Coatlicue--who is no doubt annoyed by the constant bickering.

The contest is held on a 3x3 grid within the ring of sacred statues. The ring of statues is formed by making piles of "gate chips" which surround 9 single chips which form the gate itself. The gate chips come in two styles, Runes and Stars, and the 3x3 pattern they form must be manipulated to match that of one of the special "gate cards". By arranging the chips to match the pattern of a gate card, a shaman can "unlock" the gate.

Gameplay is further complicated by the presence of several types of "special" chips as well as "spell" cards that are activated when a gate card is "unlocked".

The first player to successfully "unlock" two of the face-up gate cards PLUS a final gate card from their own hand, will be declared the winner. The loser is then sacrificed during the ensuing celebration to the merriment of all.

Name: Séð og heyrt skemmtispilið
Description: A trivia game based solely on news and articles from the glamor magazine Séð & heyrt (an Icelandic version of the Danish magazine Se & Hør). There are 2100 questions about the famous, various happenings and glamor stories. Play can be for 2-6 people or for teams with 1-6 players.

Name: Zorogolf
Description:
Zorogolf is a golf simulator game played with dice and cards. A course of nine holes is waiting you. Lakes, the forest, bunkers,... try to beat the course and your opponents by choosing the correct club.

Choose an iron or a wood and shoot for the hole in one!

Name: Astrópía
Description: A game of adventure, based on the Icelandic movie Astrópía. 2 to 6 players compete in this game to find a necklace of power and bring it back to Dagur. The characters can use various rpg-based items to aid them in this quest.

Name: Íslenska fuglaspilið
Description: A simple educational game about Icelandic birds. The game comes with a CD with the calls of 30 birds. Rules for three kinds of games are included, Sound Bingo, Photo Bingo and Memory. The bingo cards have photos of 9 birds each and the players either listen to bird calls or are shown photos of a bird and try to get a bingo. Memory is simply a memory game with photos of birds.

Name: Ljómarallýspilið
Description: This game is based on an international Rally competition held in Iceland for a few years, called the Ljómarally. A simple roll and move game where you try compete in the Ljómarally both on special (closed) routes and ferry (open) routes. Players can both compete in stand-alone rallies or a summer long championship.

Name: Preums !
Description:
Preums! is a free card game for 3-6 players. Everyone plays as a blogger, trying to build the more valuable blog in order to sell it. The game is quick and fast : most actions are played simultaneously. The card are drawn by webcomics artists, the game is available or free on the Internet.

Aim of the game

You have to meet around your blog the most valuable visitors. After that you can raise founds. Be the first one to have a "six zero worth" weblog.

Home Page: http://preums.webcomics.fr/page/sets-de-cartes-premi%C3%A8re-fourn%C3%A9e

Name: Schule fertig-Los!
Description:
Come on, let's go to school! How exciting the everyday life of a school kid can be. Only the one who gets up promptly and is punctual at the bus stop will get to school on time. There the hurly-burley continues. With all the other children and the interesting things to learn, the day passes in a flash.

While playing, the children will learn how their day will change when they start going to school. Further on, memory and first handling of the clock are trained in a playful way. The instructions contain several variants including one for cooperative play. all of differing degrees of difficulty.

Name: The All New Dating Game
Description:
Which players will be paired off as the most "date-able" couples? You'll find out in this unique home adaptation of television's popular game show of dates and mates!

First players secretly write down their answers to questions, and then they vote on the ones they liked best. When all the votes are tallied, players are revealed to each other and the matchmaking begins!

Name: There's No Place Like Rome...and Oneida County
Description:
There's No Place Like Rome ...and Onieda County

This is a monopoly-style game about Rome, New York and the surrounding region. It was produced by the City of Rome and the Rome Area Chamber Of Commerce.

Includes a colorful game board featuring local tourist attractions, 4 tokens, red plastic chips, play money, 2 dice, rules, business cards, deed cards, and a storage insert.

Name: Small Commercial Real Estate Lending Game
Description: The object of the game is to become the wealthiest mortgage broker through commissions earned by closing loans on the properties shown on the game board.  This game was created by Interbay Funding to expand the knowledge of mortgage brokers and others who originate loans for small businesses.

Name: Take2
Description: Take2 "The fast thinking word game" comes with instructions and 120 letter tiles.  Each player starts with 8 tiles and uses them to make words in crossword/scrabble style in front of themselves. When one player has used all their tiles they call "Take2" and all players draw 2 more tiles to add to their stock. Words can be rearranged at any time and play continues until all tiles are in the players hands and one has used all their tiles. At that time points on tiles not in use count against those players. Several rounds can be played, adding the scores and the lowest scoring player winning after the agreed number of rounds.

Name: The Inmost Sea: The Battle of Lepanto 1571
Description:
“…for the inmost sea of all the earth is shaken with his ships.
They have dared the white republics up the capes of Italy,
They have dashed the Adriatic round the Lion of the Sea,
And the Pope has cast his arms abroad for agony and loss,
And called the kings of Christendom for swords about the Cross…”
                    from Lepanto
                    by G.K. Chesterton

1571. Suleiman the Magnificent, the law-giver, is dead.

With Cyprus falling to the Turks, Pope Pius V calls the squadrons of Europe together to stop the Ottoman advance.  Given the command is the 24-year old Don Juan d'Austria, bastard son of the Holy Roman Emperor.  By the end of a fateful October afternoon, the Catholics will have won an inestimable moral victory and Suleiman's son Selim would have to drain his empire’s coffers to rebuild his shattered fleet from scratch.

Thanks to remarkable surviving records of the order of battle, The Inmost Sea simulates this epic clash at the individual ship level. Ostensibly a two-player game, also playable with fog-of-war solitaire rules, or as multiple independent wing commands with three players to a side.  Play any of the three wings in separate scenarios, or the entire grand battle.  Also includes several alternate history setups.

Game & graphic design by Mark Mahaffey
Cover painting by Radoslav Javor
Leader portraits by Leona Preston

Name: Oh la l'Art
Description:
From the box:
"An amusing, competitive game for all the family.  A new game based on a familiar idea.

"Have a lot of laughs! A competitive game focusing on 3 key figures to be completed for bonus points, while each player assembles as many sets as possible.

"The game includes:
- 27 Head cards
- 27 Torso cards
- 27 Foot cards
- A poster containing 27 full color reproductions presenting the complete works of art and their creators.
- Instruction sheet with rules of the game."

About the game:
Players try to assemble complete figures based on famous works of art by making sets of heads, torsos and legs/feet.  Bonus points are given to the player who can completely assemble the three figures in the middle of the table.

Name: Shock Army
Description:
Shock Army was the name given to the elite fighting units of the Republican 'Ejercito Popular' (The Popular Army).  The game recreates a number of attacks by these spearhead corps.

Shock Army is designed to be played as a table top game between two players.  No map is included, but there are sufficient terrain features to fight four major scenarios.

The game is built around three fundamental concepts.  The first is the importance in battle of an army's command system, that is the way in which its headquarters is organized.  Orders from HQ's are represented by impulse counters.

The second fundamental concept is that of "fighting power".  Each unit has a total fighting power factor. In combat opposing forces compare their total fighting power factors - the unit with the higher fighting power factor is the victor.

Thirdly, every combat unit can move an unlimited distance.  However, the further a unit moves in one go, the lower its fighting power will fall.  This represents the breakdown of cohesion in a unit if it is pushed too far, too quickly.

Name: El Quinielín
Description: Sports lottery using the traditional betting system of the Spanish football league. Can be played alone or between several players. A wheel is used to obtain the results. A familiar game from the 50's in Spain.

Name: Olive Oyl: I'll Catch My Popeye
Description: Actually this is a SPIN & MOVE game from Hasbro dated 1956. The game comes with a large Spinner that has numbers from 0 to 4 which determines your movement. The game also has a board with around 50 spaces of differing colors which allow Olive, equipped with her trusty rolling pin to attempt to catch Popeye. The game comes with two playing pieces, one for Olive and one for Popeye.

Name: A Power Struggle
Description: Roll to move your shuttles through four ALERT levels on your way to achieving PEACE. Use missiles and peace pawns to protect your shuttles from opponents as you move forward, engaging in the power struggle that comes with a quest for peace.

Name: Naked!
Description: From the manufacturer: Naked! has the same values and suits as a regular poker deck, but printed on each card is an article of clothing. Play your favorite poker games. When you win, you get to assign cards from your winning hand to other players. Players who receive cards have to remove the clothing that is pictured on the card. The winner is the last player remaining who is not Naked!
Families: Admin: Outside the Scope of BGG

Name: Chalenj
Description:
From the manufacturer:

Anything you can do, I can do BETTER! Chalenj! Is the all thinking, all action activity game that brings out the competitive side in everyone!! Can you name more US States than your sister? Can you beat your best friend at singing Madonna songs? Find out by racing around the Chalenj! board, chalenjing each other to be the best in four separate categories. If one player decides to Chalenj another, the glove is slapped down on the table and the fun begins. Ages 8 and up. For 2 to 6 players or teams.

Name: Scooby-Doo Pop 'N' Race Game
Description: A 2 to 4 player racing game Ages 5 and up. Race to be the first player to get all four of your movers to the finish. Comes with a colorful plastic game board with a dice popper in the center, and 16 movers.

Name: Ben 10 Omnitrix Duel for Power Game
Description:
From the manufacturer:

Go head to head against your opponent as you try to collect the most alien cards and win. The Omnitrix tells you whether you want to have the lower or the higher card during each battle. Achieve that and you add both cards to your win pile. Special cards tie the battle up and bring another, more powerful battle on!

Name: Suite Life Double the Fun Card Game
Description: Turn up cards for points until you decide to stop and you keep your points for that turn. If you keep going, you wager the amount of points you have accumulated and push your luck to gain more with each card you turn up. If you turn up a Moseby, you lose all the points you gained for that turn, UNLESS you get a Joker Zack, which makes you immune to Moseby. Collect pairs of Zack and Cody cards for extra points. The player with the most points when the cards run out is the winner.

Name: Haisuli vei
Description:
Contents: 4 double-sided playing pieces, 4 6-piece sturdy cardboard puzzles, a bell (ála Halli Galli), gaming board, a die.

Each player represents a pair of Moomin characters. Players are trying to build a boat by collecting 6 pieces of their puzzle. Each player starts from their own corner of the board. During your turn you roll a six-sided die and move your gaming piece clockwise around the gameboard. 1st player to collect all six pieces and get back to their starting corner sails to the lighthouse island for search of a hidden treasure.

Players get pieces for their puzzles during their own turn when they pass their starting corner or when they hit a location depicting a happy sun on the board and their gaming piece also shows a happy sun. When player hits a location that shows different sun than their gaming piece at the moment, their piece is flipped over (happy/sad).

It is possible to get a piece of the puzzle during someone elses turn: The die has numbers from 1 to 5. One side has a picture of "Haisuli" eg. Stinky. Whenever this side comes up, whoever is first to hit the bell in the middle of the board (at the lighthouse island) grabs a extra piece for their puzzle.

Also, it is possible to lose already collected puzzle pieces when you hit a sad sun and your gaming piece also shows a sad sun or when you hit another players starting corner.

Game of The Year 2007 Childrens Game finalist in Finland.

Name: Solairis
Description: Players are one representative of the seven races of the Solairis system. They duel using spells that are powered by power cards. When one has lost the last hit point they lose. If you run out of power cards the spells are reshuffled and a new hand of spell and power cards are dealt.

Name: Firaapeli
Description: A Scrabble-like word game designed and published by an advertising agency for using as a gift to their customers. You are using nine letters, there are no tripling options, doubling options are scarce and there are some extra bonuses available. The rules are constantly making fun of the advertisement world.

Name: Hell's Foxes
Description:
Hells Foxes is a board game of the North African Campaign of World War II conducted between the Axis forces of Germany and Italy and the Allied forces of United Kingdom - England, Australia, New Zealand, India, South Africa, France, Poland, Jewish Battalion, from the Spring of 1941 until the winter of 1942.
 COMPONENTS


    1 "Rules Book" consisting with a Light BLUE 'cover' which contains some "Errata", and inside 16 pages of "Rules", while the BACK 'cover' has some "Charts" and other *Notes*.
    4 Paper MAPS 11 X 16 Black on White printed with "Graphic" renditions displaying the "Terrain" from its 'genre' for "WW-2 North Africa Campaigns" at the time of publication. Adjoin these in correct 'order' from 1 to 4 and secure properly, such as with taping it down, or placing "perspex" / "plexiglas" for that. 
    3 Small Label Sheets with Front & Back images comprising:
        (1) of RED print for "Axis"
        (1) of BLUE print for "Allied"
        (1) of GREEN print for BOTH to use as "Game Markers".

Name: Valley of the Dinosaurs
Description: A spin and move board game for Ages 7 - 12. Comes with cardboard cutout players, spinner, board, and rules. Based on the Hanna-Barbera cartoon series of the same name. The object of the game is to help the Butler family make it safely across the valley to the caves.

Name: El Tesoro Escondido
Description: In this children's game, the players must reach the treasure by throwing the dice and moving on the board. During journey they will find dangers such as the giant octopus, the dungeon of doom, the infected rats and the great volcano. They should avoid these risks to get the treasure trove and win.

Name: El Listón de MARCA
Description:
El listón de MARCA is a game for most athletes and for those who know most of all about sports. It can be played by up to 5 teams of one or more players. The aim is to build the word "MARCA" with a letter of each color. This requires successfully responding to questions in every major category using the boxes provided for this purpose. During the game the players will answer several questions about the world of sports to reach the main squares where they obtain letters of different colors (tokens).

This game is a fun game for the entire family and especially for sports fans in general. The game system is based on Trivia games.

MARCA is currently the best-selling sports daily in Spain and designed this game in 1997 for sale along with the newspaper for several weeks.

Name: Romulan Ship Recognition Manual
Description:
The Romulan Ship Recognition Manual expands on the ships types seen in the base game Star Trek: Starship Tactical Combat Simulator, adding new variants for almost every Romulan ship in that product, as well as adding a number of new craft.

As with the base Star Trek: Starship Tactical Combat Simulator itself, this is ostensibly an "expansion" for the Role Playing game, in that it provides more data than just the combat element requires.  3-dimension views are provided for all craft, along with extensive historical notes and background.

The book was released with two covers, each with the same internal info. In both cases, the cover of this 48-page product features a cutaway of the Romulan 'Whitewind' cruiser. However, the first release version has only the words "ROMULAN SHIP RECOGNITION MANUAL" in red block letters on the cover, while the second version has the "framed" design shared with the 2nd Edition Federation & Klingon SRMs.

Indicating the clear tie to the wargame, the last page presents a sheet of counters that you can photocopy and mount on cardboard for use with the tactical game.

Expands:

    Star Trek: Starship Tactical Combat Simulator

Name: Le tri sélectif
Description:
The goal of this game is to score a maximum of points by playing cards representing recyclable and non recyclable wastes.
A recyclable waste is composed of two cards, and hence is worth two points.
A non recyclable waste is only represented by a single card, and is therefore only worth one point.
This is an educational game which aims at helping to distinguish recyclables wastes from non recyclable ones.

Name: Pizza Bake-Off
Description: Players attempt to complete pizza recipes by collecting different resources from various places in the kitchen.  Movement is done using addition and subtraction cards to move to various spaces - which reward the player with a topping or a special card they can use.  The board is two-sided, so that players can play with single or double-digit addition.

Name: Anno Domini: Probespiel
Description:
A regular Anno Domini set consists of 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other.

This small expansion set Anno Domini - Probespiel was a free giveaway by the publisher. It only contains about 8-15 event cards without a common theme. Since this is not enough for a real game, it only comes with a brief summary of the gameplay.

Each player receives nine of these cards (or less, if you want the game to be shorter), and may only look at the descriptions. Players then put in turn a card on the table, *trying* to put theirs in chronological order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.
If the order was correct then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives three cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.

Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in this game. Most events are rather obscure or are hard to date exactly. Anno Domini is a blast to play, it is a very enjoyable social event and you even learn something from it.

Part of the Anno Domini series

Contained as a free bonus in this German version of Such a Thing?, this German version of Zooloretto and this German version of Airlines Europe.

Name: Klingon Ship Recognition Manual
Description:
The Klingon Ship Recognition Manual expands on the ships types seen in the base game Star Trek: Starship Tactical Combat Simulator, adding new variants for almost every Klingon ship in that product, as well as adding a number of new fighters, ships, and bases.

As with the base Star Trek: Starship Tactical Combat Simulator itself, this is ostensibly an "expansion" for the Role Playing game, in that it provides more data than just the combat element requires.  3-dimension views are provided for all craft, along with extensive historical notes and background.  The cover of this 48-page product features a cutaway of the Klingon D-20 'Deathrite' cruiser.

Indicating the clear tie to the wargame, the last page presents a sheet of counters that you can photocopy and mount on cardboard for use with the tactical game.

Expands

    Star Trek: Starship Tactical Combat Simulator

Name: Friday Night Fights
Description:
"YOU CAN RUN BUT YOU CAN'T HIDE."

A twenty-foot square ring doesn’t give you much room to move and definitely nowhere to hide. Boxing - it’s called the “Sweet Science” for a reason. You can move around your opponent flicking jabs and dancing away. “Rope a dope” and pick your spots firing punches and scoring points. All that skillful stuff, putting on a boxing clinic and looking pretty while you’re doing it. Then.... BOOM!
Your opponent throws a hook from downtown and “out go the lights!”

Friday Night Fights is unlike any boxing game you've ever played. With FNF you can... Build your fighter the way you want him. Boxer or slugger it's all up to you.

     Fight your way to the title through 36 pre-generated fighters that are run by the game mechanics.
     Become a promoter with your own fighters. Train them and pick and choose your opponents on your way to the top.


Everything you need to start your own “fight club” with your friends is included. It’s an exciting game where you have to think as you fight. Do you go “all out” as soon as the bell rings? Or maybe pace yourself for the full fight? And what’s he doing?

Do you have the heart of a Champion? Only you can tell. Friday Night Fights – “Play to win…”

Name: Federation Ship Recognition Manual
Description:
The Federation Ship Recognition Manual expands on the ships types seen in the base game Star Trek: Starship Tactical Combat Simulator, adding new variants for every Federation ship in that product, including new shuttles, starships, freighters, and starbases.

As with the base Star Trek: Starship Tactical Combat Simulator itself, this is ostensibly an "expansion" for the Role Playing game, in that it provides more data than just the combat element requires.  3-dimension views are provided for all craft, along with extensive historical notes and background.  The cover of this 42-page product features a cutaway of the Federation 'Remora' escort craft.

No counters are provides with this product, however, the last page is a fold-out diagram showing a time line of the service lifetimes of the various ship classes, as well as silhouettes of all ships showing relative sizes.

Name: Sauve Qui Peut
Description:
From 1790 to 1815 Europe was at war with itself and dragged most of the rest of the world with it. The Napoleonic Wars are Earth’s first true World War. England and France had colonies all around the planet. Many of the other nations entered the fray. Most note worthy was the War of 1812, the USA v Great Britain.

SQP is a chance for players to take one of the armies of the
combatants into one of the large battles that denoted combat for that period. Experienced players can easily maneuver 40 or more battalions. The rules are historical and designed for a medium degree of difficulty. Veteran gamers will feel comfortable after a walk through. Players new to gaming will be able to compete after their first game.

SQP is designed for two to six players to enjoy a three hour game.

Armies list for the 17 major European nation, the Ottomans and
Americans are included.

Name: The Battle of Sharpsburg
Description:
This is a tactical simulation of the American Civil War battle near Sharpsburg on 17 September 1862. The components include:
1 8x10 map
1 set of rules 2.5 pages long including charts & tables
1 set of 26 counters; 10 Union, 15 Confederate & 1 game turn

The Union Infantry are Corps-sized, the Confederate Infantry are Division-sized.  No scale is given for distance on the map or for each (of the 10) turns.  Mechanics are a simple yugo-igo, but rough terrain and ample artillery make things interesting.

Original images are provided, as well as some graphically-updated images.

This is a good example of what early DTP-like self-publishing could do.  Remember ... 1975 ... 33 years ago.

Name: Numeralogic
Description: Players attempt to guess other players' secret number in the fewest number of turns through a combination of luck and logic. The game can be played by selecting anywhere from 2-5 digits depending on the time available and the ability of the players. Numeralogic is similar to Mastermind except each player selects a secret number and guessing alternates.

Name: Speedway Racing
Description:
(from their website)

Calling All Race Fans
CATCH THE EXCITEMENT OF "BIG TIME AUTO RACING"!

If you love stock car racing, you must play Speedway Racing's board game. The Speedway Racing  board game gives you 'big time stock car auto racing' and 'live event track action' for true, behind the wheel racing experiences.

At the Drivers Meeting, you will receive your Drivers Handbook and will learn the rules of the race.
With one to five drivers, choose your favorite car, then 'start your engines'. Drivers race their cars around the oval track based on a roll of the dice. There are Bonus Points in the game. If you are lucky enough to roll doubles or other combinations imprinted, on the Speedway Racing game board, you will accelerate your advancement around the track.

During the Driver's meeting, you also learn that this will be a fast paced, five-lap competition. You will be driving against other highly competitive opponents. There are many Challenges and Pitfalls ahead of you as you speed around the track to take your car, to the coveted "Winner Circle", of Speedway Racing's board game.

Before you begin, choose Option 1, for the first driver to cross the finish line. Or, Option 2, in case all drivers are 'stacked up' and trying to cross the finish line. One last roll of the dice will determine the winner. You must choose Option 1 or Option 2, before the race begins.

The Race is Underway! Of course, the object of the game is to win the race, but beware; there are advantages and obstacles as you thunder around the track.

Hit the "Pit Stop" Zone or the "Speedway Challenge" Zone and adjust your position based on the events of each opportunity. Hit the wall and you suffer the consequences, in your quest. If you can avoid an accident, you will advance your position on the track.

Take care in selecting your pit crew. Many track advantages will depend on the timing, action and reaction speed of your pit crew.A driver can pilot the race car, but the pit crew will make the crucial difference in the outcome of the victory.
    
As in real speedway racing, your pit crew is vital! The Speedway Racing Board Game track graphics are beautifully illustrated. The game's race cars are authentic 1:144 scale die-cast metal with moving wheels.

The "Challenge" cards and "Pit Stop" cards are
realistic 'during the race' events. As you position your car and maneuver around the track, you will encounter cars hitting the wall, track debris, flat tires and yellow flags.

Caution Flags Are Out! Beware of Hazards!!

White-knuckle rookie drivers could hit the car in front of them, have stalled engines or make serious driving errors, while lapped traffic slows you down. The events of the "Speedway Racing" board game will impact the sheer adrenaline rush of moving forward, as you concentrate, on the coveted first place win. As you cross the Finish Line, move your car into the "Winner's Circle".

Each game contains a highly detailed graphic game board, five 1:144 scale die-cast cars with moving wheels, drivers challenge cards, dice and directions, in a re-usable bag. Family board game enthusiasts may want to have multiple games for their weekly or monthly family board game night.

The rules, of this family board game, are easy enough for the youngest race fans, but challenging enough, to keep you and the other drivers ever watchful on the track.

Name: Mutação
Description:
One player plays is the mutant and can become any object in the environment in which they play. The others players have to discover the color, shape and position of the mutant.
The mutant can only answer the questions with yes or no.

Name: Aventura no Mar
Description:
Adventure at Sea.

Meet the pirates and recover the treasure of King!

In this game, one player is the adventurer, who needs to find the Island of Treasure, the other player is the pirate, who hides the treasure.

This game is similar to Aventura na Selva

Name: Batalla Aeronaval
Description:
This game represents a combat between a squadron of planes and a naval fleet.

The objective is to obtain 2000 points. Every successful shot turns to 50 points.

A disc is in use for determining the radar's length  and allows to know the position of the shot.

Content:
- 1 Board
- 10 ships
- 10 planes
- 20 point pieces
- Radar disc

Name: Pile It
Description:
from the website

Pile it™ Card Game
A high speed flipping & sorting game

Less than 4 minutes per game

On your mark, get set...
PILE it on! Players use quick eyes and nimble fingers in a revved-up race to see who can flip and sort their cards the fastest – by color, by number, and then by picture. Packed full of speed, concentration, and competition, Pile it is full throttle fun for the entire family!

Name: Disney Wheel of Fortune
Description:
From the manufacturer:

Combine the puzzle-solving fun of Wheel of Fortune with the magic of Disney-Pixar movies and you get a game that's entertaining for the whole family. Spin the Mickey Mouse wheel, then ask for a letter to the puzzle. Categories include: Heroes and Heroines, Villains, Movie Titles, Song Titles and more. Collect Disney dollars for uncovering letters and solving the puzzles.

Name: DinoX
Description: Based on the hit show from the BBC "Walking with Dinosaurs", this trivia game features cards with 1500 questions, 4 realistic dinosaur skeletons to assemble, and a DVD with footage from the show. Every question you answer correctly, you get to put another piece on your dinosaur skeleton. Race to be the first to complete your skeleton.

Name: Monopoly: Tallinn
Description: The Estonian version of classic Monopoly. Each block on the map represents a famous location in Tallinn, Estonia.

Name: Nana Shogi
Description:
Billed as "The World's Smallest Shogi Variant," Nana Shogi is played on a 3x3 board with two identical sets of three pieces. Rules are similar to the parent game, Shogi, but some pieces are cubes that can be promoted through a cycle of four faces taken from several other Shogi variants.

The Three Types of Pieces

     A conventional Shogi king
     An orthogonally-moving piece (Rook/Chariot/Swallow's Wings/Go-between)
     A diagonally-moving piece (Bishop/Tile General/Cat's Sword/Dog)

Name: Cats At Play
Description:
BOX DESCRIPTION
"Chasing catnip here and there"

Unique Features:

     Game allows participants to understand cat behavior.
     Game requires players to be responsible for the care of their cats.
     Game makes players use planning and logic to win.
     Game demands participants exercise patience with their cats.
     Game enables players to enjoy the companionship of cats.
     Game lets contestants make both offensive and defensive moves per turn.
     Game provides players with variations for more difficult games.
     Game promotes cooperation and teamwork.


HAVE FUN!

GAME OBJECTIVE (from manual)
The first cat to pounce on a catnip mouse is the winner.

GAME PLAY
Players work cooperatively (cats from the same house) or against each other (different house) to catch one of two 'roaming' catnip mice. Each player first moves their cat, then moves one of the mice, each with the roll of one die.

Other variations allow for players to only move their cats with another player moving only the mice.

Obstacles include: Other cats, Dogs, Identification Tag (if missing), Fleas, Health Care (shots)

Name: Not Tonight Josephine Expansion Pack
Description:
This expansion for Not Tonight Josephine comes as a standard size box of trivia questions the same size as the base game, or the more well known boxes from Trivial Pursuit. As well as new questions new rules are included for how these different format questions are used in the game.

This time instead of questions from two random categories there are four colour coded cards each corresponding, each colour corresponding to a a quarter of the board. Each card has seven  questions corresponding to the categories from its section. Now you can choose to answer a non-multiple choice question from the topic directly for a chance to win a coin, or you can still treat it like the base game and draw a card with two random multiple choice questions.

Double Trouble and Quotations, the only categories that appear 4 times instead of once on the board, are treated the same as in the base game.

Expands:

     Not Tonight Josephine

Name: Dementalism
Description:
DementalismAlright, smarty buns, here's your chance to show everyone how smart your brain is. Due to the continuing idiocy of you and your fellow security guards a whole bunch of clones have escaped from the Primordial Soup Kitchen and are now wandering the various countrysides of Mutha Oith. You guys better get your wazoos in gear and recapture them before your bosses find out and you lose your jobs.

It’ll take all of your brains, half your luck, two thirds of your charm, a bunch of guts, and a pinch of divine inspiration to survive this fast-paced and exciting original card game by award winning illustrator and game designer Andy Hopp.

Peeps: 2-12
Ages: 8+
Durations: 30-60 minutes
Contents: 128 cards, instructions, setup card, sticker

The Gist of the Thing

Security at the Primordial Soup Kitchen, that ridiculously wondrous and mythical repository of Oith’s genetic legacy, has been lax of late, to say the least. Following an insane night of fermented circuspi nut binging, impromptu (and painful) interior redecorating, and decidedly unsexy pillow fighting between you and your fellow guards you awoke from a grog-addled stupor to discover someone left the goosin’ doors open. Again.

It wouldn’t be such a bad thing under normal circumstances, but a while back the honchos decided it would be a good idea to start stockpiling clones of various important denizens of Oith (and some unimportant ones for practice). You know, in case of calamity or somesuch. Well, thanks to you and your cronies, these clones (three of each!) are now wandering the countryside, clueless and confused.

You guys should probably get your wazoos in gear and nab those hapless triplicates before they fall into the Keister of Gawd or get eaten by something. Oh, and whoever finds the most denizens doesn’t get fired or fed to anything.

The Beginning

Step 1: Gather unto thee a bunch of friends. Arrange them around a table or some other suitable playing surface.

Step 2: Take all the cards and shuffle them up really well. Then lay some of them face-down on the table in a grid 8 cards wide and 8 cards long. If your table is too small you can use a smaller grid (6 cards x 6 cards, for example). This is called the SPREAD.

Make sure each player has enough table space in front of him or her to lay a row of several cards side by side. This space, the STORE, will eventually be used to house the player’s STACKS (the cards a player collects throughout the game). Also, designate a spot somewhere on the table for the KEISTER OF GAWD (the discard pile). Set the rest of the cards facedown in a pile known heretofore as the HEAP.

Step 3: Read the rest of the rules.

Useful Terms

Cards: There are three different types of cards a peep will encounter:

Denizens represent the various peeps that escaped from the Primordial Soup Kitchen. The Spread contains three of each Denizen.

Giggities have the zazzy ability to copy the traits of other organisms. Thusly, they can form a Stack with any Denizen.

Turmoil Cards represent assorted events, catastrophes and phenomena that affect the game in various ways. Sometimes they’re good, sometimes they’re not.

Denizen Power: A special ability granted by a Safe Stack. A player may only use one Denizen Power each turn.

Flip: To turn a card face-up.

The Heap: The draw pile.

The Keister of Gawd: The Discard Pile.

Nab: To steal a Stack.

Reveal: To turn a Stack face-up. Revealed Stacks stay that way until the end of the current player’s turn, unless otherwise denoted.

Peek: To look at a Stack or card without revealing it to the others.

The Spread: The face-down grid of cards that forms the primary playing area.

Stacks: Matching cards collected throughout the game. Three types of Stacks exist. Each is worth a different amount of points.

Sneaky Stack (1 point):A Denizen and a Giggity.

Stacked Stack (2 points): Two identical Denizens.

Safe Stack (4 points): Three of the same Denizen. A Safe Stack can NEVER be discarded or nabbed by another player. That’s why it’s called a Safe Stack.

The Store: The area directly in front of each player that houses the Stacks the player has collected. Stacks in the Store are always laid from left to right in the order they were collected. Sneaky Stacks and Stacked Stacks are laid face-down, while Safe Stacks are face-up.

How to Play

The most flatulent player (by consensus) goes first. Here’s what you do on your turn:

Step 1: Flip over any one card in the Spread. If it’s a Turmoil card do what it says. If it’s a Giggity or Denizen leave it in place face-up (unless you can make a match with the Denizen).

Step 2: Flip over a second card. If it is a Turmoil card do what it says. If it’s a Denizen or a Giggity you have options:

Two Giggities: If both of the flipped cards are Giggities toss them both in the Keister of Gawd.

One Giggity & One Denizen: If one of the revealed cards is a Denizen that matches a Denizen in one of your Sneaky or Stacked Stacks you may snatch it up and insert it into the matching Stack. Adding a card to a Sneaky Stack makes it a Stacked Stack. Discard the Giggity into the Keister of Gawd. Adding a Card to a Stacked Stack makes it a Safe Stack. You may now flip it over. It can’t be stolen and you immediately have access to that Denizen’s Power (you can still only use one Denizen Power per turn, though).

If one of the revealed cards is a Denizen and the other is a Giggity you may snatch them both up and create a Sneaky Stack.

If one or more of the cards is a Denizen and you think you know where another player has a Stack that matches that Denizen you may try to steal the Stack from the other player. Point to the face-down stack in front of the other player and demand to see it. The player flips over the stack, revealing it to everyone. If you are correct, and the Denizen in the Stack matches the one you flipped, you Nab the Stack from the other player and add it to your Store. If you are incorrect, your turn ends immediately and you LOSE YOUR NEXT TURN. The owner of the wronged stack flips it back over and play continues.

Two Different Denizens: If both cards are Denizens who don’t match each other and you don’t know where a matching stack is, flip both cards back over and play passes to the next player. If one or more of the revealed cards is a Denizen that matches a Denizen in one of your Sneaky or Stacked Stacks you may snatch it up and insert it into the matching Stack (discarding the Giggity to make a Stacked Stack or combining three Denizens to make a Safe Stack.

Two Identical Denizens: If you flip two of the same Denizen you may combine them into a Stacked Stack and place it in your Store. If you already have a Sneaky Stack featuring the same Denizen you may discard the Giggity from the Sneaky Stack and combine the Denizen with the Stacked Stack to form a Safe Stack.

If you suspect another player has a Sneaky Stack featuring the flipped Denizen you may attempt to nab it as described in the previous section.

Step 3: Used Turmoil cards go to the Keister. Unmatched or undiscarded Giggities get flipped back over. Fill in any gaps in the Spread with face-down cards from the Heap. Once the Heap is depleted just leave the gaps empty.

Step 4: Your turn is over. Play progresses clockwise around the table unless a Turmoil card or Denizen Power indicates otherwise.

Sidenote:  You may look at the Stacks in your own Store whenever you want, but if you do you must temporarily flip them over for everyone to see.

Denizen Powers

No doubt the observant among you have noticed a block of text at the bottom of each Denizen card. This describes the special power you can access once you have that Denizen in a Safe Stack (all three matching Denizen cards).

Each turn, once you’ve acquired one or more Safe Stacks, you may choose to initiate the power from ONE Denizen. You may activate the power at any point during your turn, but you can only use one Denizen Power per turn and you may not use the same Denizen Power two turns in a row (even if you only have one Safe Stack).

As soon as you get a Safe Stack you can access that Denizen’s Power (as long as it’s your turn and you haven’t already used a Denizen power that turn). Some Denizen Powers are activated by the actions of other players and can be used whether it’s your turn or not, as long as you haven’t already used one that turn (such as Squiggins Neverlost’s ability to avoid lost turns).
When you activate a Denizen Power turn the relevant Safe Stack the other way around (but still face-up) to signify its usage. Turn it back around at the start of your next turn.

Ending the Game

Once the Spread has been depleted and all the cards are either in the Stores or the Keister of Gawd, the game is over. Whoever has the most points, determined by the type and number of Stacks in each player’s Store, is the winner and gets to keep his or her job as a hapless minion of the Primordial Soup Kitchen. Everyone else gets fired or fed to something horrible.

In the event of a tie, whichever tieing player has the most Safe Stacks wins. If it’s still a tie the win goes to the player with the most Stacked Stacks, then the most Sneaky Stacks. If it’s still a tie after that the world blows up and nobody wins.

Stack Values

Sneaky Stack (1 Giggity & 1 Denizen): 1 Point

Stacked Stack (2 Denizens): 2 Points

Safe Stack (3 Denizens): 4 Points

Name: YALA
Description: An abstract strategy game played on a circle of 12 spaces, on which white and black pieces are stacked.  A piece moves as many spaces as there are pieces in the tower in which it starts, and the object is to prevent one's opponent from moving by building "blockades" five pieces high.

Name: High 7
Description:
A dexterity/strategy game in which players stack wooden cuboids with the object of reaching a height of seven units.  Careful use of the space and of the pieces left in hand can force the opponent to make disadvantageous moves.

Ein neues Spiel im Giseh Verlag, wie gewohnt in hochwertiger Ausführung, spannend und mit hohem Spaßfaktor für Jung und Alt! Es gilt, je nach Augenzahl der Würfel die eigenen Steine zu setzen um die siebte Ebene zu erreichen, die siegreiche Punkte birgt - jedoch ohne dem Gegner zu viel Spielraum zu lassen. Bieten Sie ihm keine Möglichkeit, die eigenen durchdachten Spielzüge für seinen Erfolg auszunutzen... eine ruhige Hand und räumliches Sehvermögen helfen bei dieser kniffeligen Herausforderung. Wer Spielsteine umwirft, hat verloren!

High begeistert Kinder und Erwachsene gleichermaßen, da es leicht zu erlernen ist und auf spielerische Weise sowohl räumliches Denkvermögen als auch haptische Fähigkeiten fördert.

Name: X: Die 4. Dimension
Description:
A four-in-a-row game on a 4×4×4 cube.

Variation 1:

Players are trying to form four in a line. The twist in this variation is that each player rotates one of the levels of the cube through 90 degrees after their turn.

Variation 2:

Variation 3:

Similar to:

    Qubic - Played on 4x4x4 cube (4x4 grid with 4 layers) but without turning layers
    Score Four - 4x4 grid of pegs that are filled from the bottom up
    Dimensions(1970), Hi!Noon: Das Duell(2009), and Tic Tac Turn(2011) - the 4 individual horizontal board layers (4x4 each) of the 4x4x4 grid can turn
    3D5 - which is played on a 5x5x5 cube (5x5 grid with 5 layers) but without turning layers

Name: Oktaeder
Description:
In Oktaeder ("Octahedron") players take turns to stack one of their marbles into the playing area, building up an octahedron as the game progresses.  The object is to form lines of four marbles of the player's color.

Oktaeder is similar to Kessler's game Giseh! but with an octahedral playing area instead of a pyramid.  A transparent stand is provided with the game to hold the base of the octahedron during gameplay.

Name: Askim
Description: This card game has 40 cards. 5 color-coded sets of 8 cards each. 4 cards in each set are question cards, 4 cards are answer cards. The object of the game is to be the first to get rid of all of your cards.

Name: Trail Blaze
Description:
Trail Blaze contains burning questions, high stakes and pot luck. Reactions may include intense rivalry, feelings of euphoria, and an increased awareness of cannabis and it's effect on your health and liberty. Trail Blaze may leave you with a clear head that persists for days, months or even years. However, taking too many risks can lead to unpleasant side effects.

Players take it in turns to roll the dice and move their counter the corresponding number of squares in the direction of the arrows.

If you land on a question square someone else must read you a question card. If you answer correctly, go forwards to the next green square. Get it wrong and go back to the last red square.

If you land on a risk square, take a risk card and follow the instructions. Return cards to the bottom of the pack.

The winner is the first player to get home.

Name: Suomirokkia trivia: Lisäkysymykset 2007
Description:
200 new question cards for Suomirokkia trivia. Also includes Genius-questions for the "real sages".

Expands:

    Suomirokkia trivia

Name: Space, Trash, Politicians
Description:
This game is being revised. I wouldn't suggest playing by the posted rules. 3/30/09

The people of Earth make a lot of trash, and there's no sign this will change anytime soon. Crates full of banana peels, boxes of secondhand chicken poop, industrial mumbo-whatever, it's all here, and it needs to go somewhere. At one point, a fantastic US President said, "Let's get a big rocket..." and things progressed from there.

You are a waste removal specialist, and you want to get in on some of these contracts for sending waste into space, but where there are rockets, money, and politicians, things can get messy.

A game of bidding and risk management, with just 60 little cards.

Name: Gissa vad jag föreställer
Description: Swedish charade type game. Aimed primarily at children. The title translates roughly into "Guess what I am supposed to be".
